modules.description: This module manages dynamic, thread-local ambient state using a heterogeneous map. It supports creating and manipulating typed keys for storing and retrieving values within a scoped context. Concrete use cases include managing request-specific data in servers or tracking contextual metadata across asynchronous operations.

This module manages ambient context propagation in asynchronous workflows using a key-value store, enabling scoped, thread-local state management across concurrent operations. It provides a monadic bind operator for optional values and a storage module for creating and manipulating typed keys to store and retrieve request-scoped data like authentication tokens or configuration settings. Submodules support dynamic context scoping, letting developers track metadata across asynchronous boundaries or maintain per-request state in server applications. Example uses include injecting user identity into nested async calls or dynamically configuring logging based on context.
